overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting focused on capturing daily seasonality in hourly data. The forecaster systematically analyzes historical patterns, evaluates multiple heuristic methods, and selects a simple averaging technique due to data limitations. The approach prioritizes interpretability and computational simplicity while maintaining alignment with observed seasonal patterns.
common_data_patterns: Daily seasonality (lower nighttime values, higher daytime values)
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the dominant pattern requiring explicit modeling
Averaging same-hour observations across days effectively captures seasonal patterns with limited data
Forecast horizons matching seasonal cycles (e.g., 96 hours for 24-hour patterns) enable pattern repetition
Value rounding to match input precision (3 decimals) maintains data consistency
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed seasonal pattern analysis and manual computation, but avoids advanced statistical models due to interface constraints. Focuses on heuristic methods with clear step-by-step justification.
